title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University
Interview Descriptions: First interview was by phone with only one interviewers Second interview was a panel interview. Five interviewers asking questions and you have a five minute response time. It was a bit overwhelming and would be very difficult for diverse candidates especially neurodivergent candidates.
Interview Questions: Describe how I would ensure diversity?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University
Interview Descriptions: A normal standard and simple interview that would be expected with a college student job. Mostly about work history and organizational skills. They also ask if you like CCU housing.
Interview Questions: What past jobs have you had?

title: Lab Prep Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University
Interview Descriptions: Casual sit down interview with overview of the lab and an introduction to the professors that I would be working with for the semester. Also reviewed class schedules to ensure there was enough time to prep for each week before the first lab of that week.
Interview Questions: Are you available on the weekends?

title: Summer Undergraduate Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with the site director. answered basic questions about why i was interested in the topic and what made  me want to work at Coastal Carolina University in their summer research program.
Interview Questions: what led you to your interest in fluid mechanics

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University
Interview Descriptions: Shortly after I applied I had an interview with 4 people and they took turns asking questions to me. It was about a week after my interview that I received a job offer for them.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness and how do you overcome this?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Conway, SC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great process and amazing people who work had and care about the individual and ensuring your success not only in work but also in school. It’s amazing to see how much emphasis they put on balancing student and work life, really great job here at the university

title: Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Conway, SC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an enjoyable and calm experience. Handed me a list of rights and rules to abide by while I was filling out my paperwork. When greeted by my two interviewers they gave me a list of question they were going to ask as they also read the questions out loud.
Interview Questions: How will you be able to handle 3 clients at the desk first?

title: Assistant to the Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Jacksonville, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied and got a call a month later for an interview.  There was a panel of five people. Questions were fairly simple.  They were nice, but went with someone else.  They did call though to let me know, which was nice so I wasn't waiting around.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a supervisor?

title: Testing Center Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Conway, SC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very smooth and easy. I thought it would be the best job in the world but job only lasted a month and a half. Seemed like the director was forced into retirement and she hired two new bilingual employees to help out during the transition. New director got rid of two new employees and fast as she could. Working for Coastal Carolina University is great however, some employees need more training.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that will help with this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Conway, SC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received an email about the interview . Went in the interview was easy . Ask simple questions . Nothing hard . Also brought another student worker in to ask one question .
Interview Questions: If you have a problem , so you mind asking for help.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process, made to feel very welcome. Search Committee members were warm and inviting. Dean was very approachable. Although stressful, I really enjoyed my time during the interviewing process. I think I have said it all, and do not need to keep writing to pad up the minimum requirements.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University
Interview Descriptions: Typical professor interview process for this type of university: phone interview, and later onsite research presentation and teaching demonstration.
Interview Questions: I do not recall a difficult or unexpected question.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Conway, SC)
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview followed by an on-site interview. The search committee seemed pretty laid back and the attendance at my teaching seminar was very low. Everyone was nice, but morale seemed to be lacking.
Interview Questions: All questions were standard - none stand out as being difficult.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Coastal Carolina University (Conway, SC) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: took place with several staff and student workers at the same time. unorganized and highly political to get the job. If you don't know someone who has worked there for a while don't bother applying.
Interview Questions: what are the good qualities about myself
